entry.title: The Future of AI in Procurement: Why Your Best Colleague Might Be a Bot
entry.content:
I was halfway through an evening run with my husband when I realized something that stopped me in my tracks—literally. For the past ten minutes, he'd been telling me about a conversation he'd had about a core project at work. He described how his colleague Chad had helped him think through a complex problem, offered creative solutions, and even challenged some of his assumptions. The advice was spot-on, and the conversation was completely natural and engaging. 

Then it hit me: "Chad" wasn't a new team member. Chad was a chatbot. 

This moment crystallized something I've been thinking about a lot lately as I work with procurement leaders around the world. AI isn't coming to procurement—it's already here. And the transformation it's bringing to complex processes like RFP creation and supplier management is more profound than most realize. 

The Invisible Revolution 

When AI works as intended, it operates seamlessly behind the scenes, supporting us to move further, faster, and with less stress. Think about the last time you wrote a text message. Those predictive words that appeared as you typed: that's AI. When your bank flags a suspicious transaction before you even notice it—AI again. How about the customer service chat that helped you resolve your issue at midnight? That’s most likely an AI-powered system. 

Just last month, I was speaking with members of a team focused on digital solutions for procurement at a Fortune 500 company. We were discussing their advanced sourcing solutions when I mentioned AI capabilities. They said, "Oh, we're not using AI yet" but after I asked a few questions about their current RFP processes, it became clear they were leveraging advanced AI for sourcing events; they just didn't realize it. 

This invisibility is actually AI's greatest success story, particularly in complex procurement workflows where multiple technologies work together to streamline what were once manual, time-intensive processes. 

The RFP Challenge: Where AI Shows Its True Value 

Let me share a story that illustrates exactly why this matters for procurement professionals.  

I still remember creating my first sourcing event—it was for trade show booths, and I had no idea what I was getting into. The research alone took days, from finding the right vendors to writing questions and tracking all the details. I easily spent two weeks just drafting the RFP. Then came the real challenge: manually reviewing each proposal, pulling key data points, and building comparison spreadsheets. I constantly worried I was missing something important. 

According to SAP benchmark data, * after gathering initial requirements and shortlisting suppliers, the average procurement team then spends about 6 hours just populating and researching spend categories to create RFPs—but with AI, they spend only 2 hours, which is a 70% reduction.  


This is exactly why AI represents such a game-changer for procurement.  

When AI Becomes Your Colleague 

Which brings me back to Chad and my eye-opening run. My husband’s story illustrates something profound happening in workplaces everywhere: AI is becoming less of a tool and more of a teammate. But the real magic happens when AI understands the context and complexity of your specific business needs. 

This is true in our personal lives as well. For example, my family recently took the trip of a lifetime to Greece. While we were exploring, we found ourselves standing before Zeus's temple with only a basic map. My husband pulled out his phone and told our AI assistant: "I'm on vacation with my family at Zeus's temple. We only have a map to guide us. Can you tell us the history of where we are?" 

Within minutes, our digital guide—whom we playfully nicknamed "Uncle Chad"—provided us with rich historical context and details that brought the ancient stones to life. The key was context. Our AI companion understood where we were and what we needed, and delivered exactly the right information at the right moment. 

This same contextual intelligence is what makes AI transformative for RFP processes and Statement of Work development. Instead of spending weeks building sourcing events from scratch, imagine describing your needs in natural language and having an AI partner that understands your organization's templates, supplier network, and approval workflows.

Joule: Your AI Sourcing Partner  

If I'd had Joule's Sourcing Agent when I was building my first RFP, I wouldn’t have spent so much time researching options and building the content from scratch. Instead, I would have simply described what I needed—the same way I explained it to my manager when asking to extend the project timeline. 

Sourcing Agent transforms RFP creation through conversational AI. It pulls from your organization's templates, applies standard terms, identifies relevant suppliers from your network, sets up evaluation criteria, and configures approval workflows.  

Beyond sourcing events, Joule serves as your strategic procurement partner. It can help you manage approvals, research past purchases, select the right templates, and support daily supplier management activities. Through our Business Data Cloud, Joule has access to centralized, harmonized business data that provides the contextual insights you need to make sense of complex procurement scenarios. 

Joule Studio takes this even further, allowing procurement teams to build custom AI agents for specific business needs with drag-and-drop simplicity. Need an agent that specializes in contract analysis for your industry? Or one that understands your unique supplier onboarding process? You can create these specialized assistants without coding, tailored to match your specific procurement workflows. 

Navigating the Challenges 

AI isn't perfect, and there are valid concerns around it today. People wonder: How does it really work? Will it "hallucinate" and give me incorrect information? After all, AI systems aren't programmed to say, "I don't know"; they're designed to provide answers, even when those answers might be based on incomplete or biased training data. There are also privacy and security concerns, as well as limitations in contextual understanding. The job displacement question looms large too.  

However, the evidence suggests AI augments rather than replaces procurement expertise. The professionals thriving with AI are those who understand its capabilities and limitations, know how to ask the right questions, and use AI to amplify their strategic thinking rather than replace it. 

The Path Forward: Start Now 

We're already using AI in procurement, whether we realize it or not. The key is to lean in now. Start with manageable use cases like RFP creation, learn how these tools work, and discover how they enhance your processes. 

What sets SAP apart is our deep grounding in business processes and data, an open and extensible framework, and built-in security and compliance, which is underpinned by our commitment to ethical AI development. SAP leads the industry in responsible AI practices, ensuring the trust and integrity that procurement organizations need when handling sensitive information, like supplier data and contract information. 

 

I hope you’ll join our September 18 webinar, “AI In Action: Practical Use Cases and Adoption Strategies for Procurement,” with me and Pierre Mitchell at Spend Matters. We'll discuss how AI in procurement can optimize resources, time, and budget, and explore how Joule can become your organization's newest team member.  

 

 

*Source: SAP Value Management. Numbers assumed for consumer products company with €1billion in revenue and 2,000 employees; annual benefits result from one or more value drivers.

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Relationship WebService Inbound
entry.content:
Hello @Simon 

You’re right, in your key mapping, you see entries with the identifier “External ID,” but the standard key mapping framework in Public Cloud currently only supports InternalID for BP replication and relationship mapping. The ExternalID identifier appears in the mapping tables, but it isn’t processed by the standard integration logic.

That’s why the lookup is failing in your case; it’s simply not in scope at the moment. If you want to work with external IDs, you’d need either an enhancement option, such as via BAdI in DRC/MDI integration, or adjust your mapping so that the InternalID is used as the anchor key.

In a nutshell, you've got it right. The External ID is stored, but it's not currently being evaluated by the standard process.

Check-Key Mapping Replication help

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: New templates for the Pipeline for Cloud Integration: enhancing the custom receiver determination
entry.content:
As mentioned in one of my last blog post New integration packages for the Pipeline for Cloud Integration, we have added two new templates in one of our new integration packages, so actually the Cloud Integration Pipeline - Templates package where we ship templates for the scenario-specific integration flows and custom exits to support the Pipeline for Cloud Integration.

Both new templates can be used to implement an alternative approach for custom receiver and receiver interface determination. Depending on your specific requirements or boundary conditions, you can call a custom integration flow to determine the list of receivers and interfaces instead of the default of running an XSLT mapping stored in the Partner Directory.

Custom receiver and receiver interface determination has been supported before with the more generic template Pipeline v2 Template Step04 - Custom Receiver Determination. Now, we have added the following two templates, namely:

  • The template Pipeline v2 Template Step04 - Custom Receiver and Interface Determination via Extended Receiver Determination has been added for an option to implement custom receiver determination based on a message mapping and by maintaining exchange properties for the interface determination. A similar approach is applied in the SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration migration tool when selecting the Pipeline migration approach.
  • The template Pipeline v2 Template Step04 - Custom Receiver and Interface Determination via Exchange Properties allows you to implement custom receiver and interface determination by maintaining exchange properties. A similar approach is applied in the SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration migration tool when selecting the standard migration approach for the Recipient List and Content-Based-Router patterns.

In the following, I will show you how the two new approaches can be exemplarily configured.

Option using Mapping and Exchange Properties

In this option, the custom receiver determination is based on a message mapping resulting in an XML message containing the list of receivers. By maintaining corresponding exchange properties and running a Groovy script, the interfaces are added to the beforehand created XML message.

Note that this option can be used as alternative to the Reuse Extended Receiver Determination in case you want to migrate an integration scenario on SAP Process Orchestration that already uses the extended receiver determination. Other than the Reuse Extended Receiver Determination option, this option results into a combined receiver and interface XML message and hence is also supported in the integrated messaging runtime.

The custom integration flow looks as follows: In a content modifier step, you have to configure the parameters and XPaths for the interface determination. Then you run your message mapping to determine the list of receivers. This results into an XML message with all receivers that the message should sent to. By the way, you need to define the configuration before you run the message mapping because the message mapping will overwrite your payload which is needed in the content modifier. Finally, you run a script to add the receiver interfaces to the receiver nodes based on your configuration.

In the content modifier, for each potential receiver <Receiver name> from the Receivers XML and for each condition for the interface determination with index <Index number> starting from 1 on, you need to maintain the following exchange parameters adhering to the naming convention:

  • SAP-IFDET-<Receiver name>~IFIndex<Index number> where you specify the XPath condition for the interface condition
  • SAP-IFENDPT-<Receiver name>~IFIndex<Index number> where you specify the ProcessDirect endpoint of the corresponding scenario-specific outbound flow
  • SAP-IFNAME-<Receiver name>~IFIndex<Index number> where you specify the receiver interface name (this is an optional parameter)

To specify the behavior for the case that the receivers XML message doesn't contain any node and no receiver could be determined, create the following parameters:

  • SAP-NOREC: could be either Ignore, Error, or Default
  • SAP-NOREC-Default: in case of Default, specify default receiver name

If the default receiver is not in the list of already specified receivers, you need to create the corresponding parameters SAP-IFDET-Default~IFIndex<Index number>, SAP-IFENDPT-Default~IFIndex<Index number>, and SAP-IFNAME-Default~IFIndex<Index number>.

Here, an example of the configuration that the script uses to add the interfaces to the Receivers XML. In our example, we have 3 receivers, each receiver has one interface only with actual no condition so we specify the XPath true(). The default type is Default and the default receiver is already configured, so no need to create the default receiver specific parameters.

Here, an example of a message mapping which builds the Receivers XML message with the list of potential receivers.

 

The Groovy script customInterfaceDeterminationViaXProperties then adds the interfaces to the beforehand created XML message.

Option using Exchange Properties

In this option, you can implement a combined custom receiver and interface determination by maintaining exchange properties and running two Groovy scripts. The first Groovy script customReceiverDeterminationViaXProperties creates an XML message containing the list of receivers based on the corresponding configuration parameters. The second Groovy script customInterfaceDeterminationViaXProperties adds the interfaces to the previously created XML message based on the corresponding configuration parameters.

For the receiver and interface determination, you need to maintain the corresponding exchange properties in the content modifier following the naming convention:

For each receiver <Receiver name>, create the following exchange property:

  • SAP-DYNREC-<Receiver name> where you specify the XPath condition for the receiver determination

The parameters for the interface determination are the same like above.

Here, an example of the configuration that the scripts use to create the combined receivers and interfaces XML. It's the same example like above, in addition to above we have added the XPaths for the receiver determinations.

For more details, see Custom Receiver Determination.

entry.title: Re: Planned Delivery Date does not update from WM to ERP...
entry.content:
Hi @mconstanzo 

Thank you for your question. I hope this delayed response still provides some support.

what you observe in your screenshots is standard behaviour in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

  • The Planned Delivery Date in the inbound delivery header (app Change Inbound Deliveries – Deliveries) is an executional field used for warehouse and goods receipt planning.
  • The Delivery Date on the item level (seen in VL32N or equivalent backend view) is tied to the purchase order schedule line and drives MRP and Manage Material Coverage.

Here are some key points you should know:

  • Changing only the Planned Delivery Date in the inbound delivery does not update the purchase order or ERP-side delivery item date.
  • MRP and the Manage Material Coverage app will still take the PO schedule line date as the planning driver.
  • Replication is triggered when certain fields (e.g. carrier, location) are updated, but not for delivery date alone.

Here is a standard solution you can evaluate:

  • If the supplier’s confirmed date changes, update the PO schedule line either via Ariba Supplier Confirmation or PO change.
  • This ensures MRP and execution processes remain aligned.
  • The inbound delivery should not be used to adjust planning; it only reflects executional adjustments.

To summarise, planned Delivery Date change in inbound delivery equals logistics execution only. Purchase order schedule line equals planning & MRP control. The correct approach is to update PO via Ariba confirmation or PO change, not through inbound delivery.

Here are some references for more guidelines:

  • Inbound Delivery Processing in S/4HANA Cloud
  • Manage Material Coverage – App Help

 

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Composable Storefront SSR Profiling in SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

SSR profiling can be complex task and hard to debug. SSR profiling will help you to identify performance bottleneck and potential memory leak. This article will briefly show how it can be executed. 

 

In Cloud with Dynatrace

Dynatrace doesn't give detail trace but it can be good start for the investigation.

Application Observability > Profiling and Optimisation > Continuous CPU profiling > server.mpjs jsapp-* > Method hotspots 

It can a view on thread dump for JavaScript code execution. In below, we can see an example with ratio execution during specific windows time. High percentage means many threads go through this call trace.

 

Locally

Deeper analysis can be executed locally page by page. NodeJs/SSR is not supposed supporting directly end-user traffic. It is why single request profiling should be large enough to identify potential improvement.

 

Prerequisites

If your SSR execution is slow, it can fallback to CSR. Before the profiling, please ensure you setup a long timeout value in server.ts

const ngExpressEngine = NgExpressEngineDecorator.get(engine, {
  timeout: 10_000,
  ssrFeatureToggles: {
    avoidCachingErrors: true,
    limitCacheByMemory: true,
  },
});

Message that indicates CSR fallback

"message":"SSR rendering exceeded timeout 3000, 
fallbacking to CSR for /electronics-spa/en/USD/"

CSR fallback can be also caused by not verified SSL certificate indicated by this message

UNABLE_TO_VERIFY_LEAF_SIGNATURE

In this case, you have to update server.ts to ignore SSL signature verification like this

function run() {
  const port = process.env['PORT'] || 4000;
  process.env['NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED'] = '0';
...

 

Inspect

Edit package.json and update ssr startup line by adding --inspect option in NodeJs.

"scripts": {
    "ng": "ng",
    "start": "ng serve",
    "build": "ng build",
    "watch": "ng build --watch --configuration development",
    "test": "ng test",
    "start:ssr": "node --inspect dist/webshop/server/server.mjs",
    "build:ssr": "ng build"
 }

Then you can start your Composable Storefront in SSR mode and attach Chrome debugger

% npm run start:ssr
> webshop@0.0.0 start:ssr
> node --inspect dist/webshop/server/server.mjs

Debugger listening on ws://127.0.0.1:9229/5dc67436-a3d3-4480-9e01-6051684e7afe
For help, see: https://nodejs.org/en/docs/inspector
{"message":"[spartacus] SSR optimization engine initialized",...
Node Express server listening on http://localhost:4000
Debugger attached.

After that, you open Chrome with this following URL chrome://inspect/#devices

Click on inspect to get web developer console to analyse thread and memory dump. Start a recording and just after do frontend request on the page where you want to perform the analysis. In below, you can see example on HomePage from sample website : http://localhost:4000/electronics-spa/en/USD/

 

Profiling

Another approach is to execute NodeJS with --prof option

Start SSR with this following command

% node --prof dist/webshop/server/server.mjs

Load page you want to analyse, HomePage for example: http://localhost:4000/electronics-spa/en/USD/

Run NodeJs analyser on the thread log files generated during the rendering

node --prof-process isolate-*log > process.txt

Edit process.txt to read analyse report, in below in example

Statistical profiling result from isolate-0x148008000-60288-v8.log, 
(551 ticks, 523 unaccounted, 0 excluded).

 [Shared libraries]:
   ticks  total  nonlib   name

 [JavaScript]:
   ticks  total  nonlib   name
      3    0.5%    0.5%  Builtin: LoadIC_NoFeedback
      3    0.5%    0.5%  Builtin: InterpreterEntryTrampoline
...

 

Conclusion

SSR optimisation is not necessary for end-user traffic. However, it should be fast enough for responding in acceptable time to CDN system. Often between 1s to 5s is considering a respectable time. Over 5s, SSR profiling should be executed to understand where bottleneck is located : OCC API backend call, rendering, state management, and so on.

If you need more support, please don't hesitate to contact SAP Expert Services.

entry.title: Re: Not able to pick the quantity in the delivery
entry.content:
Root causes could be

Even though stock is available, the system may not allow picking because:

  • The stock is not in the correct stock type or storage location expected by the delivery.
  • The delivery item is trying to pick from unrestricted stock, but the returned goods were scrapped or posted to blocked stock.
  • The requirement type KE (MTO) expects stock tied to the original sales order item, not general inventory.

Areas to check

  • In VL02N, check if the storage location is populated in the delivery item. If not, the system won’t know where to pick from. You can manually enter the correct storage location or configure automatic determination
  • Use MB52 or MMBE to verify is the stock in unrestricted use?, is it in the correct plant + storage location? and is it tied to the original return order item (especially for MTO)?
  • In VL02N, check the delivery header and item for any blocks. Sometimes a delivery block inherited from the return order can prevent picking.

To fix this, assuming that the stock is available but not being picked:

  • Try manually assigning the storage location in VL02N.
  • If the stock is tied to the return order item, ensure the SD-FC delivery is referencing that correctly.
  • If needed, transfer stock from blocked to unrestricted using MB1B with movement type 343 or MSR_INSPWH (if inspection is involved).

entry.title: Re: Decentralized EWM. ID created against a STO is receiv...
entry.content:
What’s happening behind the scenes is even without explicit inspection setup in ERP (no inspection type, no Q-group), EWM can still trigger a quality inspection document if certain conditions are met in the EWM configuration. Here's why:

1. Inspection Object Type (IOT) Configuration in EWM
In Decentralized EWM, inspection documents are created based on Inspection Object Types (IOTs). If your system has IOTs like IOT 4 (Inbound Delivery) or IOT 5 (Recurring Inspection) active, EWM may still generate inspection documents—even if ERP isn’t expecting them.

2. Inspection Rule in EWM
Even if no inspection rule is explicitly assigned to the material, a generic or default inspection rule might be active at the warehouse level. These rules can be triggered based on Document type (e.g., inbound delivery from STO), Partner or vendor, Product group or warehouse process type

3. QI02 Status in EWM
Status QI02 means, Inspection document created in EWM, but no inspection lot exists in ERP. This typically happens when ERP doesn’t have an inspection type assigned to the material. The integration between EWM and ERP for QM is incomplete or misconfigured. The event linkage or BAdI that triggers inspection lot creation in ERP is missing or inactive.

To fix this what you can do is

  • In EWM, go to /SCWM/QINSP and review the inspection document. Check if an inspection rule is active for the product or warehouse. Review IOT settings under SPRO → Extended Warehouse Management → Quality Management → Define Inspection Object Types
  • In ERP, Check the material master, is inspection type 01 or 04 assigned? Is QM activated for the plant?
  • Use QA32 or QVM2 to verify if any inspection lot exists. If not, ensure the event linkage between EWM and ERP is active BAdI QEVA_INSPLOT_CREATE or similar should be implemented to create inspection lots in ERP from EWM triggers.

If you want to prevent this behavior entirely, you can:

  • Deactivate the inspection rule or IOT in EWM for STO-based inbound deliveries.
  • Or, fully configure ERP QM so that inspection lots are created and processed properly.

entry.title: Re: Include a field to FIORI app Mass change of purchase...
entry.content:
Why you can't see item fields in Adapt UI is because, in the Public Cloud edition, the app is built with restricted extensibility:

  • Adapt UI only allows changes to the header section.
  • The item section is not exposed for UI adaptation or field extension.
  • Even if you've added a custom field (like Requisitioner) to the PO item via the Custom Fields and Logic app, it won’t appear in the mass change app unless SAP has explicitly enabled it in the backend CDS view.

Do the following:

1. Check the Business Context of Your Custom Field
Make sure your field was added under Business Context: Procurement: Purchasing Document Item (MM_PURDOC_ITEM). This is correct for item-level fields.

2. Verify CDS View Enablement
SAP uses specific CDS views to expose fields in Fiori apps. In Public Cloud, you cannot manually extend these views. If the field isn’t exposed in the relevant CDS view used by the mass change app, it won’t be available—even if it exists in the backend. You can check SAP Note 3592364 which confirms “It is not possible to extend the app with new fields. Backend is hardcoded with the fields available.”

3. Alternative Workaround
If you need to mass-update item-level fields like Requisitioner, consider using Excel-based mass upload via the Manage Purchase Orders app., or Creating a custom RAP-based Fiori app that allows item-level mass changes or Raising a feature request via SAP Influence Portal if this is a recurring business need.

entry.title: Help Needed – Error Running ZDMO_CL_FE_TRAVEL_GENERATOR in Learning Journey
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am following the learning journey “Getting Started with Creating an SAP Fiori Elements App Based on an OData V4 RAP Service.”

Currently I’m in Section 3: Getting an Overview of ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model, specifically the “Creating an OData V4 Service” exercise.

I have completed all prerequisites carefully:

  • Using the latest Eclipse version with ADT installed.

  • Successfully created an ABAP Cloud project.

  • My BTP trial instance is active and the ABAP Cloud project is connected via the service instance URL. (see img1 for ABAP perspective in Eclipse).

Issue:
When I try to create a package with a unique ID using the ZDMO_CL_FE_TRAVEL_GENERATOR class, I encounter the following error:

Runtime Error: DBSQL_DUPLICATE_KEY_ERROR 08/29/2025 16:20:18 CB9980004150 (220017f0-9674-49fc-b51d-58d40532baa6)

I have:

  • Repeated all steps twice.

  • Uninstalled and reinstalled Eclipse + ADT tools.

  • Still getting the same error.

Since this step is required for the following exercises, I cannot proceed further in the course without resolving it.

Has anyone else faced this issue or can suggest a fix/workaround?

I will attach the screenshots and full error log below.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards,
Luis Hernández.

I don't see any way to attach text files so I wil be pasting the error log here:

What happened?

What happened?

Error in the ABAP application program.

The current ABAP program "ZFE_DATA_GENERATOR_001426=====CP" had to be terminated because it found a
statement that could not be executed.

An exception has occurred in class "CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB". This exception was not caught
in procedure "IF_OO_ADT_CLASSRUN~MAIN" "(METHOD)" or propagated by a RAISING clause.
Since the caller of the procedure could not have anticipated this
exception, the current program was terminated.
The reason for the exception occurring was:
The reason for the exception is:
When an Open SQL array insert is performed, trying to insert a record
into the database table "ZFE_ASTAT_001426" causes the function to terminate if a
record with the same key already exists.

(When an Open SQL individual record insert is performed, this situation

The procedure is in program "ZFE_DATA_GENERATOR_001426=====CP". Its source code begins in line 1 of

entry.title: Re: How the capacity planning works in warehouse manageme...
entry.content:
While the public cloud version of SAP offers robust warehouse management capabilities, it does have some constraints compared to on-premise EWM. That said, your requirement can be mapped with a combination of configuration and intelligent process design.

Core Concept: Capacity Planning in SAP Public Cloud WM

SAP Public Cloud Warehouse Management supports bin-level capacity control based on Weight, Volume, Number of handling units or products. Each storage bin can be configured with Maximum weight capacity (e.g., 1.0 TO or 1.5 TO), Maximum volume, Maximum number of quants or HU types. The system checks these limits during putaway and stock placement.

To map your scenario, follow the below steps

1. Define Storage Bins with Capacity
Use the Warehouse Storage Bin master data object Bin A → Capacity = 1.0 TO, Bin B → Capacity = 1.5 TO. SAP Help confirms that bin-level weight and volume can be configured in Public Cloud. Warehouse storage bin 

2. Enable Batch-Specific Units of Measure
Ensure that SS wire rolls are batch-managed and that batch-specific UoM is active. This allows the system to recognize the actual weight of each roll during GR. Use synchronous GR via inbound delivery.

3. Configure Putaway Rules
Use Putaway Strategies to guide bin selection. Strategy 1: If weight ≤ 1.0 TO → search for 1.0 TO bin, Strategy 2: If weight > 1.0 TO and ≤ 1.5 TO → search for 1.5 TO bin, Strategy 3: If 1.0 TO bins are full → allow fallback to 1.5 TO bin (with up to 4 rolls). This logic can be configured using Storage Type Search Sequence, Storage Bin Type Search, Capacity Check Settings. These are part of the configuration activities in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC). SAP Learning portal 

4. Use Capacity Check During Putaway
Activate capacity check at the storage type level. System will evaluate bin capacity before confirming putaway. If bin is full, it will skip to the next available bin based on strategy.

5. Fallback Logic for Overflow
To allow up to 4 rolls in a 1.5 TO bin, Define bin type to accept multiple quants. Set maximum number of products per bin to 4. Ensure the putaway strategy allows mixed storage if needed.

entry.title: How to add an additional user or e-mail address to the SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
You have an SAP Universal ID Account and need guidance on how to add an additional user or email address? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered with this straightforward guide! 

 

If you already have an existing SAP Universal ID, you can easily add additional email addresses in the SAP Account Manager and link associated S-user or P-user ID(s) using the below simple steps.

Here’s how:  

  • First, login with your SAP Universal ID account email and password in the SAP Account Manager: https://account.sap.com/sam/landing. 
  • Next, click on "Add Identity" in the upper right corner of your screen. 

     

  • Enter the e-mail address associated with the S/P-user ID(s) you want to link and click "Submit".   
  • Confirm your submission by entering the verification code that has been sent to your email address.  
  • Click “Verify”. Then, the associated P/S user ID will be linked successfully. 

 

For more details, please refer to KBA: 2882908 - How to add an additional user or e-mail address to the SAP Universal ID (UID) - SAP for Me.

Note: As per KBA 3360451, a maximum number of 10 e-mail addresses can be linked, and a maximum number of 200 users can be linked with your SAP Universal ID account. 

 

Note: 

During the SAP Universal ID registration (see KBA 2882963), after you verify your email address, you can link accounts or change settings of your SAP Universal ID by visiting the SAP Account Manager. The system will retrieve the IDs that match the e-mail address that you have verified & automatically link them. If no IDs are found, click the "Add identity" button (as outlined above). That way you can link your additional email addresses with their S/P-users IDs from the very start. 

An email address (with or without associated S-/P-User) can be linked to only one SAP Universal ID. If the email address is already a part of another SAP Universal ID account, the email can't be added to another one and SAP Universal IDs cannot be merged.  The relevant email address from the existing SAP Universal ID needs to be removed or, delete the entire duplicate SAP Universal ID first before you can add the email address to another SAP Universal ID account. 

 For more details on how to request unlinking S-user/P-user ID(s) or email addresses, and/or deleting the entire duplicate SAP Universal ID, please refer to the KBA 3619621. 

 

Additionally, an email address added without being associated to an S/P user will prompt you to make a choice with an "Action required" reminder as below:  

 

For any questions or issues with your SAP Universal ID account, please create a case under the component XX-SER-UID, or contact the Customer Interaction Center (CIC) for assistance and guidance.  KBA: 560499 - Customer Interaction Center: Hotline - Email - Chat. 

 

Helpful KBAs & Links:  

  • SAP Universal ID - FAQ  
  • KBA: 2882938 - How to reset or change SAP Universal ID (UID) password - SAP for Me 
  • KBA: 2962360 - How to change the primary e-mail address - SAP Universal ID (UID) - SAP for Me 
  • SAP News Center

 

Got More Questions? 

Please note that the Customer Interaction Center is always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have!   

Alternatively, please feel free to ask us in the Q&A  All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

 

Don't Miss Out on Free Webcasts 

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on https://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home. These sessions are open to all the users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at learning.sap.com. Please feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance. 

 Lastly, you may want to access all SAP CIC Blogs here:  https://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap. 

 

Thanks for reading!  We hope you found this guide helpful.

entry.title: Re: Hide Succession nomination data
entry.content:
Hi @DeeptiChaudhary ,

Appreciate your query. It is very common in large organizations.

Grant the system admin group the permissions to manage positions, but leave Succession permissions (Succession Org Chart, Matrix Reports, Succession Planning, Approval, etc.) only for dedicated Succession Planner roles.

To explain further, 

Sharing with you a fictitious example for better understanding :

1. Separate Position Management and Succession Permissions

Example:
Let’s say you have a system admin named Alex Smith in Australia.

  • Alex Smith (Australia) is added to the "System Admin - Positions" permission role in Role-Based Permissions.

  • This role gives Alex access to all positions, so Alex can create, edit, or delete them across the Australian entity.

  • However, in the System Admin - Positions role, you do NOT assign any succession permissions (like Succession Planning, Succession Organization Chart, or Matrix Reports).

  • Result: Alex Smith can manage every position, but cannot see any succession data (no nominee lists, no readiness, no talent cards, etc.) for those positions in Australia or anywhere else.

2. Create Dedicated Succession Planner Roles

Example:
You have a dedicated succession planner called Priyanka in Australia.

  • Priyanka (Australia) is included in the "Succession Planner - AU" permission role.

  • This role gets access to Succession Planning, Succession Organization Chart, and Matrix Reports.

  • The target population for this role is set specifically to Australian employees and positions.

  • Result: Priyanka can view and manage succession data only for Australian positions and people. She cannot access positions or succession data outside of her target population, and others (like Alex Smith) with just position management access cannot see succession data.

Summary Table

Name Country Role Permissions What they can see
Alex SmithAustraliaSystem Admin - PositionsManage all positions, NO successionCan manage all positions in Australia, but CANNOT see succession data
PriyankaAustraliaSuccession Planner - AUSuccession permissions, AU onlyCan view/edit succession data for AU positions/people ONLY
 
This setup ensures your admins like Alex can manage positions on a global or country level without ever seeing sensitive succession information—while planners like Priya can work only with the succession data they need.
 
Hope it answered your query.
Try it and let us share your Wins !!!
 
More Success To You !
Regards,
Niladri
 
SAP SuccessFactors Succession & Development  @DeeptiChaudhary

CONSTANTS:
gc_bo_key TYPE /bobf/obm_bo_key VALUE 'ZMY_FREIGHT_AGR_BO', "TODO
gc_node_root TYPE /bobf/obm_node_key VALUE 'ROOT', "TODO
gc_node_item TYPE /bobf/obm_node_key VALUE 'ITEM', "TODO
gc_node_rate TYPE /bobf/obm_node_key VALUE 'RATE', "TODO
gc_assoc_root_item TYPE /bobf/obm_association_key VALUE 'ROOT_ITEM', "TODO
gc_assoc_item_rate TYPE /bobf/obm_association_key VALUE 'ITEM_RATE'. "TODO

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Node attribute structures (DDIC) – supply the global type names
* as found in /BOBF/CONF_UI (Node Data Structure)
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
CONSTANTS:
gc_ddic_root TYPE seoclsname VALUE 'ZFA_ROOT_S', "TODO e.g. /SCMTMS/S_FA_ROOT
gc_ddic_item TYPE seoclsname VALUE 'ZFA_ITEM_S', "TODO e.g. /SCMTMS/S_FA_ITEM
gc_ddic_rate TYPE seoclsname VALUE 'ZFA_RATE_S'. "TODO e.g. /SCMTMS/S_FA_RATE

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Types for file rows (external IDs kept as string for safety)
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_hdr,
agr_id TYPE string, "External ID in file
agr_type TYPE string,
valid_from TYPE string, "YYYY-MM-DD or YYYYMMDD
valid_to TYPE string,
carrier_bp TYPE string, "Business Partner ID
currency TYPE waers,
END OF ty_hdr.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_itm,
agr_id TYPE string,
item_id TYPE string,
lane_from TYPE string, "Location IDs / Codes
lane_to TYPE string,
service TYPE string, "Optional: freight/service code
END OF ty_itm.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_rate,
agr_id TYPE string,
item_id TYPE string,
rate_id TYPE string,
rate_value TYPE string, "Decimal as string
rate_unit TYPE string, "e.g. KG, KM, PER_SHIP
currency TYPE waers, "If per-rate currency applies
calc_base TYPE string, "Optional: calculation base
min_amt TYPE string, "Optional
max_amt TYPE string, "Optional
END OF ty_rate.

TYPES: tt_hdr TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_hdr WITH DEFAULT KEY.
TYPES: tt_itm TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_itm WITH DEFAULT KEY.
TYPES: tt_rate TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_rate WITH DEFAULT KEY.

DATA: gt_hdr TYPE tt_hdr,
gt_itm TYPE tt_itm,
gt_rate TYPE tt_rate.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* BOPF artifacts
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA: lo_srv_mgr TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager,
lo_trx_mgr TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_transaction_mgr,
lt_mod TYPE /bobf/t_frw_modification,
ls_mod TYPE /bobf/s_frw_modification.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Key maps: external IDs -> BOPF instance keys
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_map_hdr,
agr_id TYPE string,
key TYPE /bobf/conf_key,
END OF ty_map_hdr.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_map_itm,
agr_id TYPE string,
item_id TYPE string,
key TYPE /bobf/conf_key,
END OF ty_map_itm.

DATA: gt_map_hdr TYPE HASHED TABLE OF ty_map_hdr WITH UNIQUE KEY agr_id,
gt_map_itm TYPE HASHED TABLE OF ty_map_itm WITH UNIQUE KEY agr_id item_id.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Message aggregation
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA: gv_created_root TYPE i,
gv_created_item TYPE i,
gv_created_rate TYPE i,
gv_failed TYPE i.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Local helpers
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
CLASS lcl_util DEFINITION FINAL.
PUBLIC SECTION.
CLASS-METHODS split_line
IMPORTING iv_line TYPE string iv_delim TYPE c
EXPORTING et_fields TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
CLASS-METHODS read_file_lines
IMPORTING iv_file TYPE rlgrap-filename iv_app TYPE abap_bool iv_skip_hdr TYPE abap_bool
EXPORTING et_lines TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
CLASS-METHODS str_to_dats
IMPORTING iv_str TYPE string
RETURNING VALUE(rv_dats) TYPE dats.
CLASS-METHODS str_to_curr
IMPORTING iv_str TYPE string
RETURNING VALUE(rv_curr) TYPE curr17.
CLASS-METHODS mk_new_key
RETURNING VALUE(rv_key) TYPE /bobf/conf_key.
CLASS-METHODS create_node_data
IMPORTING iv_ddic_name TYPE seoclsname
EXPORTING er_data TYPE REF TO data
CHANGING cs_ok TYPE abap_bool.
CLASS-METHODS set_comp
CHANGING cs_data TYPE any
IMPORTING iv_name TYPE string iv_value TYPE string.
CLASS-METHODS flush
CHANGING ct_mod TYPE /bobf/t_frw_modification
IMPORTING io_srv TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager
io_tm TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_transaction_mgr
iv_test TYPE abap_bool
EXPORTING ev_failed TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lcl_util IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD split_line.
DATA lt TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
SPLIT iv_line AT iv_delim INTO TABLE lt.
et_fields = lt.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD read_file_lines.
DATA lt TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
IF iv_app = abap_true.
DATA lv_line TYPE string.
OPEN DATASET iv_file FOR INPUT IN TEXT MODE ENCODING DEFAULT.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_sy_file_open.
ENDIF.
WHILE sy-subrc = 0.
READ DATASET iv_file INTO lv_line.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
APPEND lv_line TO lt.
ENDIF.
ENDWHILE.
CLOSE DATASET iv_file.
ELSE.
cl_gui_frontend_services=>gui_upload(
EXPORTING filename = iv_file filetype = 'ASC'
CHANGING data_tab = lt
).
ENDIF.
IF iv_skip_hdr = abap_true AND lt IS NOT INITIAL.
DELETE lt INDEX 1.
ENDIF.
et_lines = lt.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD str_to_dats.
DATA lv TYPE string VALUE iv_str.
REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '-' IN lv WITH ''.
REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '.' IN lv WITH ''.
REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '/' IN lv WITH ''.
CONDENSE lv NO-GAPS.
"Try YYYYMMDD then DDMMYYYY
IF lv CP '________'.
rv_dats = lv(8).
ELSEIF lv CP '________'.
rv_dats = lv+4(4) && lv+2(2) && lv(2).
ELSE.
rv_dats = '00000000'.
ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD str_to_curr.
DATA lv TYPE p LENGTH 15 DECIMALS 2.
REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF ',' IN iv_str WITH ''.
lv = iv_str.
rv_curr = lv.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD mk_new_key.
rv_key = /bobf/cl_frw_factory=>get_new_key( ).
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD create_node_data.
DATA lr TYPE REF TO data.
FIELD-SYMBOLS <s> TYPE any.
CREATE DATA lr TYPE (iv_ddic_name).
IF sy-subrc = 0.
ASSIGN lr->* TO <s>.
IF <s> IS ASSIGNED.
er_data = lr.
cs_ok = abap_true.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD set_comp.
FIELD-SYMBOLS <f> TYPE any.
ASSIGN COMPONENT iv_name OF STRUCTURE cs_data TO <f>.
IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <f> IS ASSIGNED.
TRY.
<f> = iv_value.
CATCH cx_sy_conversion_error.
ENDTRY.
ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

METHOD flush.
ev_failed = 0.
IF ct_mod IS INITIAL OR iv_test = abap_true.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

io_srv->modify(
EXPORTING it_modification = ct_mod
IMPORTING eo_message = DATA(lo_msg)
et_failed_key = DATA(lt_failed)
).

io_tm->save(
IMPORTING eo_message = lo_msg
).

ev_failed = lines( lt_failed ).
CLEAR ct_mod.
ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* File parsing
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM parse_header_file USING it_lines TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
DATA lt_fields TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
LOOP AT it_lines INTO DATA(lv_line).
lcl_util=>split_line( EXPORTING iv_line = lv_line iv_delim = p_delim IMPORTING et_fields = lt_fields ).
IF lines( lt_fields ) < 6.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.
APPEND VALUE ty_hdr(
agr_id = lt_fields[ 1 ]
agr_type = lt_fields[ 2 ]
valid_from = lt_fields[ 3 ]
valid_to = lt_fields[ 4 ]
carrier_bp = lt_fields[ 5 ]
currency = lt_fields[ 6 ]
) TO gt_hdr.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

FORM parse_item_file USING it_lines TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
DATA lt_fields TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
LOOP AT it_lines INTO DATA(lv_line).
lcl_util=>split_line( EXPORTING iv_line = lv_line iv_delim = p_delim IMPORTING et_fields = lt_fields ).
IF lines( lt_fields ) < 4.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.
APPEND VALUE ty_itm(
agr_id = lt_fields[ 1 ]
item_id = lt_fields[ 2 ]
lane_from = lt_fields[ 3 ]
lane_to = lt_fields[ 4 ]
service = COND string( WHEN lines( lt_fields ) >= 5 THEN lt_fields[ 5 ] ELSE '' )
) TO gt_itm.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

FORM parse_rate_file USING it_lines TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
DATA lt_fields TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string.
LOOP AT it_lines INTO DATA(lv_line).
lcl_util=>split_line( EXPORTING iv_line = lv_line iv_delim = p_delim IMPORTING et_fields = lt_fields ).
IF lines( lt_fields ) < 5.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.
APPEND VALUE ty_rate(
agr_id = lt_fields[ 1 ]
item_id = lt_fields[ 2 ]
rate_id = lt_fields[ 3 ]
rate_value = lt_fields[ 4 ]
rate_unit = lt_fields[ 5 ]
currency = COND waers( WHEN lines( lt_fields ) >= 6 THEN lt_fields[ 6 ] ELSE '' )
calc_base = COND string( WHEN lines( lt_fields ) >= 7 THEN lt_fields[ 7 ] ELSE '' )
min_amt = COND string( WHEN lines( lt_fields ) >= 8 THEN lt_fields[ 8 ] ELSE '' )
max_amt = COND string( WHEN lines( lt_fields ) >= 9 THEN lt_fields[ 9 ] ELSE '' )
) TO gt_rate.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Build modifications: headers -> items -> rates
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM build_headers USING io_srv TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager.
DATA lr_root TYPE REF TO data.
DATA lv_ok TYPE abap_bool.

LOOP AT gt_hdr INTO DATA(ls_h).
"Create node payload dynamically
lcl_util=>create_node_data( EXPORTING iv_ddic_name = gc_ddic_root
IMPORTING er_data = lr_root
CHANGING cs_ok = lv_ok ).
IF lv_ok IS INITIAL.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <s_root> TYPE any.
ASSIGN lr_root->* TO <s_root>.
IF <s_root> IS ASSIGNED.
"Map common fields (ensure names match your node structure)
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'AGREEMENT_ID' iv_value = ls_h-agr_id ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'AGREEMENT_TYPE' iv_value = ls_h-agr_type ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'VALID_FROM' iv_value = lcl_util=>str_to_dats( ls_h-valid_from ) ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'VALID_TO' iv_value = lcl_util=>str_to_dats( ls_h-valid_to ) ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'CARRIER_ID' iv_value = ls_h-carrier_bp ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_root> iv_name = 'CURRENCY' iv_value = ls_h-currency ).
ENDIF.

CLEAR ls_mod.
ls_mod-node = gc_node_root.
ls_mod-change_mode = /bobf/if_frw_c=>sc_modify_create.
ls_mod-key = lcl_util=>mk_new_key( ).
ls_mod-data = lr_root.
APPEND ls_mod TO lt_mod.

"Store key map
INSERT VALUE ty_map_hdr( agr_id = ls_h-agr_id key = ls_mod-key ) INTO TABLE gt_map_hdr.
gv_created_root += 1.

"Batch flush
IF gv_created_root MOD p_batch = 0.
lcl_util=>flush( CHANGING ct_mod = lt_mod
IMPORTING ev_failed = DATA(lv_fail)
io_srv = io_srv io_tm = lo_trx_mgr iv_test = p_test ).
gv_failed += lv_fail.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

FORM build_items USING io_srv TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager.
DATA lr_item TYPE REF TO data.
DATA lv_ok TYPE abap_bool.

LOOP AT gt_itm INTO DATA(ls_i).
READ TABLE gt_map_hdr ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<m_h>) WITH KEY agr_id = ls_i-agr_id.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
CONTINUE. "Header missing
ENDIF.

lcl_util=>create_node_data( EXPORTING iv_ddic_name = gc_ddic_item
IMPORTING er_data = lr_item
CHANGING cs_ok = lv_ok ).
IF lv_ok IS INITIAL.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <s_item> TYPE any.
ASSIGN lr_item->* TO <s_item>.
IF <s_item> IS ASSIGNED.
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_item> iv_name = 'ITEM_ID' iv_value = ls_i-item_id ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_item> iv_name = 'LANE_FROM' iv_value = ls_i-lane_from ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_item> iv_name = 'LANE_TO' iv_value = ls_i-lane_to ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_item> iv_name = 'SERVICE' iv_value = ls_i-service ).
ENDIF.

CLEAR ls_mod.
ls_mod-node = gc_node_item.
ls_mod-change_mode = /bobf/if_frw_c=>sc_modify_create.
ls_mod-key = lcl_util=>mk_new_key( ).
ls_mod-parent_key = <m_h>-key.
ls_mod-association = gc_assoc_root_item.
ls_mod-data = lr_item.
APPEND ls_mod TO lt_mod.

INSERT VALUE ty_map_itm( agr_id = ls_i-agr_id item_id = ls_i-item_id key = ls_mod-key ) INTO TABLE gt_map_itm.
gv_created_item += 1.

IF gv_created_item MOD p_batch = 0.
lcl_util=>flush( CHANGING ct_mod = lt_mod
IMPORTING ev_failed = DATA(lv_fail)
io_srv = io_srv io_tm = lo_trx_mgr iv_test = p_test ).
gv_failed += lv_fail.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

FORM build_rates USING io_srv TYPE REF TO /bobf/if_tra_service_manager.
DATA lr_rate TYPE REF TO data.
DATA lv_ok TYPE abap_bool.

LOOP AT gt_rate INTO DATA(ls_r).
READ TABLE gt_map_itm ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<m_i>)
WITH KEY agr_id = ls_r-agr_id item_id = ls_r-item_id.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
CONTINUE. "Item missing
ENDIF.

lcl_util=>create_node_data( EXPORTING iv_ddic_name = gc_ddic_rate
IMPORTING er_data = lr_rate
CHANGING cs_ok = lv_ok ).
IF lv_ok IS INITIAL.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <s_rate> TYPE any.
ASSIGN lr_rate->* TO <s_rate>.
IF <s_rate> IS ASSIGNED.
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'RATE_ID' iv_value = ls_r-rate_id ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'RATE_VALUE' iv_value = ls_r-rate_value ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'RATE_UNIT' iv_value = ls_r-rate_unit ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'CURRENCY' iv_value = ls_r-currency ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'CALC_BASE' iv_value = ls_r-calc_base ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'MIN_AMT' iv_value = ls_r-min_amt ).
lcl_util=>set_comp( CHANGING cs_data = <s_rate> iv_name = 'MAX_AMT' iv_value = ls_r-max_amt ).
ENDIF.

CLEAR ls_mod.
ls_mod-node = gc_node_rate.
ls_mod-change_mode = /bobf/if_frw_c=>sc_modify_create.
ls_mod-key = lcl_util=>mk_new_key( ).
ls_mod-parent_key = <m_i>-key.
ls_mod-association = gc_assoc_item_rate.
ls_mod-data = lr_rate.
APPEND ls_mod TO lt_mod.

gv_created_rate += 1.
IF gv_created_rate MOD p_batch = 0.
lcl_util=>flush( CHANGING ct_mod = lt_mod
IMPORTING ev_failed = DATA(lv_fail)
io_srv = io_srv io_tm = lo_trx_mgr iv_test = p_test ).
gv_failed += lv_fail.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Start-of-selection
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*

EXPORTING iv_file = p_hfile iv_app =

entry.title: Actual Return Date from Leave of Absence - Automation
entry.content:
Hi, this is regarding a Time Type that is LOA.

According to this KB article, there is no way to set the actual return date until the absence is Approved, but our absence does not requires approval at all.
https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2455646

We are looking for a way to set an Actual Return Date either with a rule or by allowing the user to set the actual return date beforehand.

Currently, users are stuck in Paid Leave status, because no one is coming back to enter an actual return date. Causing payroll issues.
On top of that, business rules (payroll related) exists to prevent absences in the past from being submitted/modified.

I was trying to build a rule to auto set the actual return date to Expected Return Date + 1.

any ideas

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: SAP S4hana cloud public edition - collate printing
entry.content:
Hello @DJY 

Thank you for your question regarding the printing of delivery notes in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

The standard SAP system does not have a setting to change the page collation order, such as switching from 1,2,3 ... 1,2,3 to a grouped sequence, like 1,1 ... 2,2 ... 3,3. While SAP Output Management allows you to specify the number of copies via Output Parameter Determination or Maintain Print Queues, the actual page sequence is managed exclusively by the printer driver or print system queue.

SAP Cloud Print Manager transfers the print job from SAP to your printer, but it does not provide a collation option.

Adobe Form templates in the Public Cloud specify layout and content only; they cannot enforce a change in page order.

If you need uncollated output, the best way is to configure this directly on your physical printer or print server. Many drivers offer a collated/uncollated option that can be set for each queue.

Some customers alternatively use a side-by-side extension on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) with the Adobe Forms service, allowing the form output to be generated with grouped pages prior to printing.

Check this SAP Documentation SAP Note 2997025 – Output Management with Print Queues (S/4HANA Cloud)

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAC and Maintenance Events
entry.content:
Hi DeannaMarch

You are welcome to SAP. Hope this information is still relevant for you.

Since you are on S/4HANA Public Cloud, you can leverage the released CDS views (data sources) and the SAP-delivered SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) integration content to get the fields you need.

  1. Maintenance Orders with Maintenance Event assignment
  • The app Find Maintenance Orders and Operations is based on the released CDS view I_MaintenanceOrderOperation and related views.
  • The Event assignment (from Planning Buckets) is available in I_MaintenanceEventAssignment and linked via order/operation keys.
  • For SAC, you can either:
    • Use these released CDS views directly in a custom analytical data set (via Custom CDS Views app), or
    • Consume the pre-delivered Analytics API (OData): API_MAINTENANCEORDER_0001 (Maintenance Order API) and join it with the event assignment view.
  1. Planner Group Name instead of Code
  • The Planner Group code is in I_MaintenanceOrder.
  • To get the Planner Group name, you need to join with I_WorkCenterPersonResponsible or I_ResourcePlannerGroup (released CDS views that provide description texts).
  • This can be modelled in a Custom CDS View (association between order à planner group à description) and then exposed to SAC.

Here is how to proceed in Public Cloud:

  1. Use the View Browser app to search for released CDS views:
    • Search terms: MaintenanceOrder, PlannerGroup, MaintenanceEvent.
  2. Create a Custom CDS View (join the required sources).
  3. Expose it as an Analytical Data Source → then connect SAC to it.

 

The following references will provide further details

Released CDS Views for Analytics (Public Cloud)

Custom CDS Views App

 

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Mass upload of the same document to equipment's avail...
entry.content:
Hi Ankit,

Hope this answer still helps you achieve your goal.

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no direct “mass upload” function in the standard apps to attach the same PDF to all equipment masters. Attachments are handled via the Generic Object Services in on-premise, but in Public Cloud this is restricted.

Below you will find some standard options

  1. Manage Equipment App (F1514A)
    • Attachments can be added manually via Services for Object à Attachments.
    • But this works only one equipment at a time.
  2. Mass Change Equipment App (F2171)
    • This allows you change multiple equipment records but does not support mass attachment upload.

The following technical Option should be considered

  • For a large-scale requirement like attaching the same PDF to all equipment, SAP recommends using the Attachment API (API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV).
  • With this, you have the possibility to:
    • Loop through the list of equipment IDs.
    • Call the API to attach the same PDF file to each equipment record programmatically.

References:

Manage Equipment

Attachment API (API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV)

Here are some recommendations to support you

  • For small volume à use Manage Equipment app and attach manually.
  • For mass upload à use the Attachment API via an automation (SAP Build Process Automation, BTP script, or external tool) to push the same PDF to all equipment objects.

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to configure the printing of reserved vouchers?
entry.content:
Hi jiangdl

I hope this still provides you with some useful information.

  1. APOC_OC_CONFIG115 error
    This error means the selected output type is not valid for the application used for reserved printing.

Below are the common causes:

  • No determination step defined for the required business object (e.g. Journal Entry Vouchers).
  • Missing form template assignment for the Output Type.
  • Printer channel not maintained under Output Channels.

To fix it, check in App: Output Parameter Determination (F2291), ensure that the output type is correctly assigned and valid for the reserved printing application. Check the output type assignment in the Output Control configuration and use the search help to verify correct mappings.

  1. Template choice for pre-printing reserved vouchers
    Standard SAP provides specific templates for printing vouchers, depending on your country and use case.
  • In Public Cloud, you must use the pre-delivered Adobe Forms provided for Finance vouchers and adapt them if necessary.
  • For reserve vouchers, the relevant standard template is usually FIN_RESERVE_VOUCHER (exact template name may vary by country version).
  • You can check available templates in App: Maintain Form Templates (F1814) by searching for “voucher” or “reserve”.

The following references will provide further details.

Output Management

Output Parameter Determination

Maintain Form Templates

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How can i change SH in delivery Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @ElifTklc 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Ship-To Party in the delivery cannot be edited by design. It is strongly recommended to make any changes at the sales order level before creating the delivery.

If your business needs alternative addresses, there are several supported options:

  • Use the standard partner function ZH (Alternate Ship-To) in the sales order.
  • Maintain the alternate ship-to address in the Business Partner master record.
  • If needed, apply In-App Extensibility (custom logic) to validate or propose addresses at order entry.

The delivery split logic based on different Ship-To addresses functions automatically when the sales order includes multiple Ship-Tos.

In summary, you cannot modify the Ship-To address in the delivery within Public Cloud; the correct method is to update it in the sales order.

SAP Useful Reference: SAP Help – Outbound Delivery Processing (S/4HANA Cloud)

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Londrina 2025: Paraguay sigue expandiendo fronteras
entry.content:
¡Una nueva aventura de aprendizaje llegó a su fin! El pasado fin de semana tuvimos el privilegio de participar en el SAP Inside Track Londrina 2025, confirmando una vez más que la comunidad SAP brasileña tiene mucho que enseñarnos y que Paraguay está cada vez más presente en estos espacios de conocimiento.

Una agenda de lujo

El evento nos sorprendió con una selección de temas súper actuales y relevantes para el mercado:

  • SAP BTP Descomplicado - Thiago Toma y Adriano Toma nos mostraron cómo posicionarse estratégicamente en el mercado actual
  • SAP QM Quality Management en S/4 HANA - Valdevair Bezerra compartió las innovaciones más importantes para la industria
  • S/4 Public Cloud: Implementación ágil y diferenciada - Jean Baena y Clariana Narcizo demostraron las ventajas de esta modalidad
  • Simplificando BTP Integration Suite - Danilo Oliveira nos ayudó a entender mejor esta poderosa herramienta
  • APIs Funcionales - Kessia Salazar explicó su aplicación práctica
  • Seguridad en Aplicaciones/Servicios en BTP en tiempos de IA: historia y evolución - Por José Sequeira @jose_sequeira 

Gratitud especial

Un reconocimiento muy especial para Jean Tiago Baena @Jean_Chess_IT por recibirnos con tanta calidez y hacer que nos sintiéramos como en casa. Su hospitalidad y la de todo el equipo organizador fueron excepcionales.

El factor humano: lo que realmente importa

Más allá de las presentaciones técnicas, lo que más valor aporta en estos eventos son las conversaciones durante los breaks, esos momentos de networking genuino donde se forjan relaciones que trascienden lo profesional. La comunidad SAP brasileña nos sigue demostrando su generosidad para compartir conocimiento.

Paraguay en el mapa SAP

Cada participación en estos eventos SIT nos da más experiencia y motivación para seguir construyendo nuestra propia comunidad. Estamos absorbiendo las mejores prácticas y adaptándolas a nuestra realidad paraguaya.

Rumbo a SIT Paraguay 2025

Con cada evento que visitamos, se fortalece más nuestra visión de realizar el primer SIT Paraguay en noviembre. Queremos que nuestros colegas locales tengan acceso a este mismo nivel de contenido y networking, sin necesidad de viajar.

¡Gracias Londrina por recibirnos tan bien! Nos vemos pronto en el próximo SIT, y esperamos que pronto sea en Paraguay.

Si eres profesional SAP en Paraguay, ¡únete a nuestra comunidad! Síguenos en LinkedIn para estar al tanto de nuestros próximos encuentros.

SAP Community  SAP Inside Track

entry.title: Re: ISLM embedded scenario in public cloud
entry.content:
Hello @nirojan_vel 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, a custom CDS view entity will only appear in the training dataset list of Intelligent Scenario Management if it has been properly released and annotated.

Release the CDS view.

  • In ADT, set the API State to Released and select “Use in Key User Apps = Yes” Your screenshot shows the correct setting.
  • Without this release step, the CDS will never appear in ISLM.

Add the correct annotations

At a minimum, include:

@EndUserText.label: 'Training Dataset'

@Analytics.dataExtraction.enabled: true

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED   // or your DCL

If it’s analytical, also use:

@Analytics.dataCategory: #CUBE

Activate and check in ISLM
After activation, navigate to Intelligent Scenario Management and select 'Datasets'. If your Z_… CDS still does not appear; it typically means the annotations are incomplete, or your user role does not have the necessary permissions.

 Authorizations
Ensure your business role includes the catalogues for ISLM modelling/embedded ML, and that the CDS is accessible to your user; adjust the DCL if needed

The cause isn't related to the “package issue / new version update.” In Public Cloud, visibility isn't controlled by the package itself. Instead, what matters are the release status, annotations, and role permissions.

Conclusion: Release the CDS with “Use in Key User Apps = Yes,” add the extraction annotations, activate, and check authorisations — then it will show up as a training dataset.

Refer to the SAP documentation below.

  • SAP Help Portal - Create and Manage Training Datasets in ISLM: This official documentation provides detailed information on the process and prerequisites.  
  • SAP Community Blog - Custom Embedded Machine Learning with ISLM: This blog offers a comprehensive, step-by-step guide to creating custom scenarios using the ISLM framework.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP XMII
entry.content:
Hello @RutwijD 

SAP has confirmed in its roadmaps and community announcements that support for SAP MII and SAP ME will continue until December 31, 2030, extending the original end date from 2027. The strategic successor is SAP Digital Manufacturing (DM) on SAP Business Technology Platform, providing both execution and analytics via Digital Manufacturing Insights (DMI).

Next steps recommendation

  • Start a fit-gap analysis of your MII/ME scenarios against DM.
  • Plan a gradual migration or hybrid strategy well ahead of 2030.
  • Enhance team skills on POD Designer, DM APIs, and Integration Suite.

Check below documentation

  • SAP Road Map Explorer – Digital Manufacturing
  • SAP Digital Manufacturing

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog
entry.content:
Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog!!!

As soon as such a Business Catalog change is published, as per SAP, "all roles need to be processed to ensure consistency since the data does not have a link anymore between the removed IAM apps and the affected catalogs."

Yes, it processes all roles in the system

In our case, it was 6000 roles in the system. As you can see, the publishing/unpublishing jobs have been running for 7 days now and still continuing. We have been in touch with SAP Support. Their explanation of how publishing works: "In general, it works like this: if a publishing process A is triggered, it is processed right away. If during this process new publishing processes B and C are triggered, this is added to a queue until the publishing process A from before is done. Then B and C will be processed together. Now, if there are 10 or 20 of them queued up, they all will be processed together and depending on the objects, this can take longer. "

There were 30-40 processes running in the system at the beginning. Now after 7 days, it has reduced to 11 processes. It locked up all the business roles for changes during the publishing process - Security team can't make any updates to roles for several days. Developers couldn't create new apps/communication scenarios/services etc. in the system. 

So, what is the workaround for this if someone really wants to remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog? The only way I could think of, is to create a brand-new Business Catalog and move whatever apps that are really needed into the new one. But, what if few months down the line, someone wants to remove another app from that 2nd Business Catalog? ... and so on...

Does this mean, to avoid all this trouble, developers should be allowed to have only one IAM app per Business Catalog? Are there any other possible ideas?
